attributes.action: Limit any fees charged by Just Giving for NHS Charities
attributes.additional_details: Because there is no accountability in these sites. At this current moment in time, Captain Tom Moore's 100th Birthday Walk for the NHS has raised around £18,179,000 - Just Giving charge 25p per donation, plus a 2.9% processing charge. At this moment there is 895386 donations - £217,346.5. And then 2.9 is £527,191. That’s £744,537.5 - there needs to be accountability in these strange times.
attributes.background: I want government to limit the fees charged by Just Giving and similar sites to what it’ll actually cost them to process any NHS charity donation pages. Ensuring they aren’t making a profit from donations at this valuable time and people’s generosity. Fees to be inclusive of labour costs.

rejection.details:
The UK Government or Parliament isn't responsible for enforcing contractual terms on specific businesses.  You could start a petition calling for a limit on payment/card fees across all industries, if that's something you'd like to see happen. 

You might be interested in the following article about Justgiving fees and Captain Moore's work:

https://fullfact.org/online/justgiving-commission-captain-tom/
